body.div1:
UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
No. 6612
ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE AND RESTRAINING ORDER
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF AKAGI, ICHITARO, For Writ of Habeas Corpus.
AKAGI, ICHITARO, Petitioner, vs. LUTHER WEEDIN, Commissioner of Immigration, Respondent.
This matter coming on to be heard upon the application of the petitioner herein for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and the Court having read the petition and being now fully advised in the premises;
IT IS ORDERED AND DIRECTED that LUTHER WEEDIN, Commissioner of Immigration, and to divers and sundry inspectors of immigration and employees of the Bureau of Immigration at the Port of Seattle in charge of the Immigration Station at said Seattle, King County, Washington, be, and they and each of them hereby are, required to be and appear in the Court Room of the United States District Court, at Seattle, King County, Washington, in the Post Office Building, at the hour of 10 o'clock on the 6th day of March, 1922, then and there to show cause if any there by, why the Writ of Habeas Corpus prayed for in the petition filed herein, should not issue in accordance with the prayer of said petitioner.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED AND DIRECTED that the above named LUTHER WEEDIN, Commissioner of Immigration in charge of the United
-1-
States Immigration Station at Seattle, Washington, together with all such inspectors and other persons acting under and by his authority, be, and each of them hereby are, enjoined and restrained from removing said petitioner from the City of Seattle and from and out of the jurisdiction of this Court pending the hearing and return upon this application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
DONE IN OPEN COURT this 3 day of March, 1922.
Jeremiah Neterer United States District Judge.
No.
In the United States District Court FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLI- CATION OF AKAGI, ICHITARO,
For Writ of Habeas Corpus.
GoB #9-Page 248
ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE AND RESTRAINING ORDER
FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT Western District of Washington NORTHERN DIVISION
Tx
MAR 3 1922
F.M. Harshberger, Clerk By S.E. Leitch Deputy
ALLEN, MARTIN & WARDALL
WINTER S. MARTIN
Attorney for Petitioner
703-4-5-10 NEW YORK BLOCK SEATTLE MAIN 7465
